definition: can/to be able to/might possibly/ability/(physics) energy

sentences.english: For the kingdom of God is not in word, but in power.
sentences.chinese: 因为神的国不在乎言语，乃在乎权能。

sentences.english: It is an important part of public prosecution power .
sentences.chinese: 公诉变更是公诉权的一项重要权能。

sentences.english: Bildad then reminded Job that God's power is beyond human understanding.
sentences.chinese: 彼耳达得然后提醒约伯，神的权能在人的理解之外。

sentences.english: While Confucius never claimed any authority of deity, Jesus did over and over again.
sentences.chinese: 孔子从未宣称有神的权能，而耶稣一再如此宣称。

sentences.english: However, there still exists controversy over the rights of land annual rent.
sentences.chinese: 但是在对土地年租制的权能问题上是有争议的。

sentences.english: She also had the power to dematerialise and rematerialise things.
sentences.chinese: 她还具有“隠化”和“显化”事物的权能。

definition: (third person pronoun for a divine being)
trustworthy/reliable/to believe something to be true
Jehovah (biblical name for God, Hebrew: YHWH)/compare Yahweh 雅威[Ya3 wei1] and God 上帝[Shang4 di4]
feudal term of praise for ruler, king or emperor/general term for saint in former times/term for God during the Taiping Heavenly Kingdom 太平天國|太平天国/Holy Spirit (in Christian Trinity)
